name: Puri Saron Seminyak Hotel & Villas
detail: Beautiful garden, excellent staff, great rooms and location.

name: Amnaya Resort Kuta
detail: I have tried two other famous 4 star hotels in Bali and i can say with full confidence that this hotel deserves to have a 5th star! Very clean rooms, towels, linens etc. Spotless. Very helpful and excited staff. Place feels luxurious. Super delicious with variety breakfast and room service. I complained about a neighbor being noisy and they did their best to control the situation and also offered me to sleep in a another room for the night. The next day, I found a hand written letter on my bed from the manager expressing his apologies, which really made me appreciate the customer service they have.

name: Kuta Paradiso Hotel
detail: The Kuta Paradiso Hotel was very nice with excellent facilities and a fantastic breakfast buffet (best we had in Indonesia)! I was a bit disappointed with the location of our room within the hotel (1st floor located above a bank of HVAC units that were loud and hot when outside on the balcony), but the room itself was fine. Location of the hotel is great, very close to the beach, a large market and central to tons of restaurants and shops. Too bad Kuta itself has become such a non-descript tourism ghetto. Nothing to do with the Kuta Paradiso Hotel, but I would not stay in Kuta again, I would look for a hotel near one of the other local beaches (e.g., Echo Beach) that are less crowded and still retain some Balinese character. There's nothing Bali about Kuta, unfortunately...

name: Pelangi Bali Hotel & Spa
detail: Whenever we have a long weekend in Jakarta, we spend it by flying to Bali and staying at The Pelangi Bali Hotel -- the best beach hotel in Bali-Seminyak. Best value for the money!

name: Canggu beach apartments
detail: This is the 2nd time I've stayed here - the first time was through AirBNB. Prices this time were much more reasonable as it was out of peak season. Apartments are tastefully fitted out with a unique style. The beds are super comfortable with quality sheets and the best pillows I've ever slept on, it was like sleeping on a cloud! Great location, right near the best Mexican in Bali Lacalita. Also very close to The Slow the best coffee and juices and a great place to do some work in the mornings with fast WiFi. Walking distance from Old Man's and The Lawn but far enough away from the noise.

name: Grand Balisani Suites Hotel
detail: This was my third trip to Bali since first visiting in 1977.I've stayed in quite a few hotels in Bali and would recommend this establishment very highly.Certainly it is a quieter and nicer venue than most (in this price range)in the Kuta area.We preferred to stay a little further out from the bustle and noise of Kuta.It has great grounds and a good quality/size pool. The hotel's shuttle will take you to Kuta but you must make your own way back.A metered taxi costs an average of 50,000 rupiah, (and about US$5 doesn't break the bank). I would recommend it and stay there again.Great shopping can be had between Kuta and the hotel. Nearby resturants are cheap an well worthy of a visit.

name: Hotel Terrace at Kuta
detail: Hotel is cozy and rooms are clean (we stayed in two rooms - 4th floor and a pool access one). All the rooms get their fair share of sunlight which serves as a great wake up call, sunlight is nice for drying wet clothes too (not all hotels have access to sunlight I am afraid). If you are staying for long, you can even just wash your clothes and leave it too dry while you roam Bali - that's what we did. The is staff is friendly and great, they're always smiling. Housekeeping is almost always ready to clean your room too. The pool is great for cooling off after a hot day at the beach or even for day tours around Bali. You can drink beer by the pool too if you wanted. Although some room neighbors might tend to be loud if they're inconsiderate (not the hotel's fault), you can always ring up the front desk to have them keep the noise down anyway. Location is close to both Legian St. and the beach, food around is great and cheap. Convenience stores also abound so if you are awake and hungry in the middle of the night you can always grab a candy bar or beer if you wanted to anytime. Since Kuta is very dense and streets are small, you get to know shop owners and staff pretty quickly which is nice since they are all just very friendly. Just smile at them back and you might just win yourself good friends, great sources of information, and cheaper special deals on tours around Bali. It helps to pass by them everyday and this hotel allows you to do just that. Fantastic Hotel overall, perhaps the very best one I have ever booked in my life time when considering everything in and around the Hotel.

name: Puri Garden Hotel and Hostel Ubud
detail: Where do I even begin? This place is bomb.com I stayed here a total of 4 different times during my 2 month long travels throughout Indonesia. LOVE LOVE LOVE this place, I couldn't help but go back every chance I had. The staff, two words: Beautiful Souls. Throughout my stay here, I had become friends with most of the staff. And let me tell you, they are good at playing match-maker and beer pong! Super friendly and light hearted, I love them all. Breakfast is yummy, and you get choice of fruit, pancakes (instagram worthy plating, I might add), mie goreng, english breakfast, and probably something else I'm forgetting. There's complimentary tea, juice, coffee, too! The rooms themselves are top notch. Fluffy duvets, comfy pillows, huge mattress, privacy curtains, shelving and outlet for personal use. Definitely the best hostel I've ever stayed at ever. EVER. There's a reason this place has such a high rating-- Just book it already, you're doing yourself a favor.

name: Grandmas Plus Hotel Seminyak
detail: You'll want to do it more than once while you're here

name: Kanvaz Village Resort Seminyak
detail: Highly recommend the lagoon pool access, worth the upgrade.
